items.title: County of Sonoma Health Officials issue Heat Alert
items.summary: The County of Sonoma Department of Health Services has issued a Heat Alert in response to the National Weather Service’s Excessive Heat Warning for parts of the county from noon Friday, July 9, through 11 p.m. Sunday, July 11.

items.title: Cal Hospital Compare Announces 2020 Honor Rolls.
items.summary: Which hospitals met maternity care performance standards in 2020? Overuse of C-sections can result in higher rates of complications like hemorrhage, transfusions, infection, and blood clots. Reducing unnecessary C-sections is a top priority for California hospitals providing maternity care.

items.title: More than 325,000 Sonoma County residents now vaccinated
items.summary: Sonoma County today surpassed 325,000 residents who have received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine, and this weekend the county is expected to surpass 600,000 total doses administered since vaccinations began more than six months ago.

items.title: County testing sites now offer BinaxNOW ‘rapid’ tests
items.summary: The Sonoma County Department of Health Services is now offering BinaxNOW “rapid” antigen testing at all DHS testing sites beginning today.

items.title: County Russian River Confluence kicks off revitalization project aimed at improving health of river communities, environment
items.summary: The County of Sonoma, in collaboration with the Russian  River Confluence, will be launching the Russian River Revitalization project this  summer to improve the health of the Russian River.

items.title: The Sonoma County Community Development Commission (SCCDC) Letter of Intent
items.summary: The Sonoma County Community Development Commission (SCCDC) released a Letter of Intent (LOI) for applicants interested in receiving COVID-19 Emergency Solutions Grant (ESG-CV) funds for Rapid Re-Housing (RRH) and Emergency Shelter (ES) projects in Sonoma County.

items.title: Do you have more questions than answers about the Covid vaccine? Meet a lead investigator on the vaccine development team.
items.summary: CDC report, June 18, 2021: These findings indicate the need for improved outreach to and engagement with pregnant women, especially those from racial and ethnic minority groups who might be at higher risk for severe health outcomes because of COVID-19. In addition, providing accurate and timely information about COVID-19 vaccination to health care providers, pregnant women, and women of reproductive age can improve vaccine confidence and coverage by ensuring optimal shared clinical decision-making.
tags: Sonoma County Maternal Child and Adolescent Health

items.title: Job Opportunities as of June 23, 2021
items.summary: View a list of our current and upcoming job opportunities, including:- Home Care Support Assistant - Public Health Laboratory Technician I & II - Extra-Help - Sheriff's Information Systems Specialist

items.title: Need Breastfeeding Support? Who you gonna call?
items.summary: It's 2:00 am, week 2 post delivery, and you are up breastfeeding again. You think- "How long is this going to last?" "Will I ever get a good night's sleep again?" "Someone please tell me this is normal and I am going to be Ok!" Who are you going to call? Can Facebook help meet the needs of Breastfeeding Women?

items.title: County’s Responsible Beverage Service Training Program Approved by the California Alcoholic Beverage Control
items.summary: The Behavioral Health Division, Substance Use Disorder (SUD) Prevention Unit, has been approved by the CA Alcoholic Beverage Control to deliver Responsible Beverage Service (RBS) Training in advance of the July 1, 2022 start date for Assembly Bill 1221, the RBS Training Program.

items.title: Recreational water users urged to be cautious about toxic algal mats in local Rivers
items.summary: The State Water Resources Control Board (State Water Board) and Sonoma County Department of Environmental Health Services advise caution for anyone who boats, fishes or swims after harmful algal blooms (HABs) were discovered in multiple Sonoma County rivers.

items.title: Sonoma County Board of Supervisors approves fiscal year 2021-22 budget
items.summary: The Sonoma County Board of Supervisors voted unanimously today to adopt a $2 billion budget for 2021-22 that makes investments in critical areas such as emergency response, vegetation management, COVID-19 recovery and the County’s pension liability.

items.title: Maternal sepsis is a leading cause of maternal morbidity and mortality.
items.summary: Maternal Sepsis is preventable, treatable, and survivable. Yet it continues to be the second most common cause of pregnancy related death in the United States. Please read below to learn more about the trends, the symptoms, and how you can help.

items.title: Permit Center Reopening Full Time; Digital Tools Remain Best
items.summary: Permit Sonoma has physically reopened our Permit Center to the public full-time, starting Tuesday, June 15, 2021. We continue to encourage the use of our digital tools. Our               online permitting services remain the best way to have your permit processed and                email is the best way to contact staff.

items.title: County of Sonoma Health Officials issue heat alert
items.summary: The County of Sonoma Department of Health Services has issued a Heat Alert in response to the National Weather Service’s prediction of consecutive days of 90 to 100- plus degree temperatures on Wednesday, June 16 through Friday, June 18, 2021.

items.title: Sonoma County to align with state reopening plan
items.summary: Sonoma County Health Officer Dr. Sundari Mase made clear today that the County of Sonoma will be aligning with the California Department of Public Health’s plans to remove pandemic-related limitations on restaurants, taverns, movie theaters and other businesses beginning on Tuesday, June 15.

items.title: County offices to fully reopen to the public Tuesday, June 15; masking and distancing still required
items.summary: Sonoma County offices will open to the public full time beginning on Tuesday, June 15, following nearly 15 months of limited in-person access due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Members of the public and employees, however, will still be required to wear facial coverings for the time being when entering county facilities.

items.title: Sonoma County to begin budget hearings June 15
items.summary: The Sonoma County Board of Supervisors next week will begin its review of the 2021-22 recommended budget totaling nearly $2 billion, which represents a 2.3 percent increase from the current FY 2020-21 adopted budget. The recommended budget reflects a return to the normal budget year timeline, after last year included a two-step process and expanded timeline to account for the impacts of COVID-19.

items.title: Medi-Cal Announces: New Broadband Benefit for Medi-Cal Beneficiaries
items.summary: Medi-Cal recipients are eligible for the Emergency Broadband Benefit (EBB) program which provides up to $50 of assistance a month to help cover the cost of internet access. The monthly discounted internet service will be available until EBB funds are used up, or up to six months after the end of the COVID-19 pandemic, whichever is sooner. Funds are limited, apply today!
